intro: Tithymalus hirsutus, commonly known as the hairy tithymalus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is often found in dry, sandy soils in open habitats. Tithymalus hirsutus is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
